tools.name: fetch_latest_nav
tools.description: The tool provides latest NAV information of all mutual funds in India from Association of Mutual Funds of India (AMFI).

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2.city name e.g.: q=Paris
3.US zip e.g.: q=10001
4.UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5.Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

tools.name: get_bmi
tools.description: Calculate the BMI of a person.

tools.name: search_information
tools.description: Search some information for the query.

num.description: The maximum number of results to return.

tools.name: get_daily_calory_requirement
tools.description: Get daily calory reqirement.

tools.name: get_body_fat_percentage
tools.description: Calculate the body fat percentage of a person.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_daily
tools.description: This API returns raw (as-traded) daily time series (date, daily open, daily high, daily low, daily close, daily volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_weekly
tools.description: This API returns weekly time series (last trading day of each week, weekly open, weekly high, weekly low, weekly close, weekly volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: get_calories_burned
tools.description: Calculate the burned calorie for a specific activity.

activitymin.description: Duration of the activity in minutes.

tools.name: get_acitcity_met_values
tools.description: Get the met values of activities.

tools.name: get_custom_ticker
tools.description: This endpoint can be used to generate a custom index in a certain currency.

if_include.description: The if_include parameter decides whether to generate an index removing specified exchanges, or only including the few that you require. True - if you want the ticker to be calculated using only the exchanges sent as query parameter; False - if you want the price to be calculated using all exchanges, but the ones sent as query parameter.

symbol.description: ETH where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD).

tools.name: get_ideal_weight
tools.description: Calculate the ideal weight of a person.

tools.name: get_food_info
tools.description: Get the information of a food.

tools.name: get_macro_nutrients_amount
tools.description: Find the amount of macro nutrients in four different categories which are balanced, low-fat, low-carbs and high-protein for a specific calorie burned.

tools.name: get_ticker_changes
tools.description: Returns ticker values and price changes for specified market and symbol.

if_global.description: True - global; False - local. Default is True

symbol.description: ETH, where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD, ETHEUR).

tools.name: fetch_historical_nav
tools.description: Fetch Historical NAV. These APIs provide latest NAV information of all mutual funds in India from Association of Mutual Funds of India (AMFI).

date.description: The date you want to check.

SchemeName.description: Scheme name of it. All scheme names can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_names' in the same script.

SchemeType.description: Scheme type of it. All scheme types can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_types' in the same script.

MutualFundFamily.description: Mutual fund family of it. All mutual fund families can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_mutual_fund_families' in the same script.

SchemeCategory.description: Scheme category of it. Scheme categories can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_scheme_categories_by_scheme_type' with param scheme_type in the same script.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2.city name e.g.: q=Paris
3.US zip e.g.: q=10001
4.UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5.Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

tools.name: get_bmi
tools.description: Calculate the BMI of a person.

tools.name: search_information
tools.description: Search some information for the query.

num.description: The maximum number of results to return.

tools.name: get_daily_calory_requirement
tools.description: Get daily calory reqirement.

tools.name: get_body_fat_percentage
tools.description: Calculate the body fat percentage of a person.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_daily
tools.description: This API returns raw (as-traded) daily time series (date, daily open, daily high, daily low, daily close, daily volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_weekly
tools.description: This API returns weekly time series (last trading day of each week, weekly open, weekly high, weekly low, weekly close, weekly volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: get_calories_burned
tools.description: Calculate the burned calorie for a specific activity.

activitymin.description: Duration of the activity in minutes.

tools.name: get_acitcity_met_values
tools.description: Get the met values of activities.

tools.name: get_custom_ticker
tools.description: This endpoint can be used to generate a custom index in a certain currency.

if_include.description: The if_include parameter decides whether to generate an index removing specified exchanges, or only including the few that you require. True - if you want the ticker to be calculated using only the exchanges sent as query parameter; False - if you want the price to be calculated using all exchanges, but the ones sent as query parameter.

symbol.description: ETH where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD).

tools.name: get_ideal_weight
tools.description: Calculate the ideal weight of a person.

tools.name: get_food_info
tools.description: Get the information of a food.

tools.name: get_macro_nutrients_amount
tools.description: Find the amount of macro nutrients in four different categories which are balanced, low-fat, low-carbs and high-protein for a specific calorie burned.

tools.name: get_ticker_changes
tools.description: Returns ticker values and price changes for specified market and symbol.

if_global.description: True - global; False - local. Default is True

symbol.description: ETH, where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD, ETHEUR).

tools.name: fetch_historical_nav
tools.description: Fetch Historical NAV. These APIs provide latest NAV information of all mutual funds in India from Association of Mutual Funds of India (AMFI).

date.description: The date you want to check.

SchemeName.description: Scheme name of it. All scheme names can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_names' in the same script.

SchemeType.description: Scheme type of it. All scheme types can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_types' in the same script.

MutualFundFamily.description: Mutual fund family of it. All mutual fund families can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_mutual_fund_families' in the same script.

SchemeCategory.description: Scheme category of it. Scheme categories can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_scheme_categories_by_scheme_type' with param scheme_type in the same script.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2.city name e.g.: q=Paris
3.US zip e.g.: q=10001
4.UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5.Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

True - if you want the ticker to be calculated using only the exchanges sent as query parameter; False - if you want the price to be calculated using all exchanges, but the ones sent as query parameter.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2.city name e.g.: q=Paris
3.US zip e.g.: q=10001
4.UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5.Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_daily
tools.description: This API returns raw (as-traded) daily time series (date, daily open, daily high, daily low, daily close, daily volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508

6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

tools.name: fetch_latest_nav
tools.description: The tool provides latest NAV information of all mutual funds in India from Association of Mutual Funds of India (AMFI).

tools.name: forecast_weather
tools.description: Forecast weather API method returns, depending upon your price plan level, upto next 14 day weather forecast and weather alert as json.

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2.city name e.g.: q=Paris
3.US zip e.g.: q=10001
4.UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5.Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

tools.description: Calculate the BMI of a person.

num.description: The maximum number of results to return.

tools.description: Get daily calory reqirement.

tools.description: Calculate the body fat percentage of a person.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_daily
tools.description: This API returns raw (as-traded) daily time series (date, daily open, daily high, daily low, daily close, daily volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_weekly
tools.description: This API returns weekly time series (last trading day of each week, weekly open, weekly high, weekly low, weekly close, weekly volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: get_calories_burned
tools.description: Calculate the burned calorie for a specific activity.

activitymin.description: Duration of the activity in minutes.

tools.name: get_acitcity_met_values
tools.description: Get the met values of activities.

tools.name: get_custom_ticker
tools.description: This endpoint can be used to generate a custom index in a certain currency.

if_include.description: The if_include parameter decides whether to generate an index removing specified exchanges, or only including the few that you require. True - if you want the ticker to be calculated using only the exchanges sent as query parameter; False - if you want the price to be calculated using all exchanges, but the ones sent as query parameter.

symbol.description: ETH where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD).

tools.name: get_ideal_weight
tools.description: Calculate the ideal weight of a person.

tools.name: get_food_info
tools.description: Get the information of a food.

tools.name: get_macro_nutrients_amount
tools.description: Find the amount of macro nutrients in four different categories which are balanced, low-fat, low-carbs and high-protein for a specific calorie burned.

tools.name: get_ticker_changes
tools.description: Returns ticker values and price changes for specified market and symbol.

if_global.description: True - global; False - local. Default is True

symbol.description: ETH, where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD, ETHEUR).

tools.name: fetch_historical_nav
tools.description: Fetch Historical NAV. These APIs provide latest NAV information of all mutual funds in India from Association of Mutual Funds of India (AMFI).

date.description: The date you want to check.

SchemeName.description: Scheme name of it. All scheme names can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_names' in the same script.

SchemeType.description: Scheme type of it. All scheme types can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_types' in the same script.

MutualFundFamily.description: Mutual fund family of it. All mutual fund families can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_mutual_fund_families' in the same script.

SchemeCategory.description: Scheme category of it. Scheme categories can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_scheme_categories_by_scheme_type' with param scheme_type in the same script.

Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following: 1. Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2. city name e.g.: q=Paris
3. US zip e.g.: q=10001
4. UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5. Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6. metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7. iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8. auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

days.description: Number of days of forecast required. Days parameter value ranges between 1 and 14. ( e.g., days=5) If no days parameter is provided then only today's weather is returned.

dt.description: Restrict date output for Forecast and History API method.For forecast API 'dt' should be between today and next 14 day in yyyy-MM-dd format (i.e. dt=2010-01-01).

unixdt.description: Unix Timestamp used by Forecast and History API method.Same function as dt.Unixdt has same restriction as 'dt' parameter. Please either pass 'dt' or 'unixdt' and not both in same request. e.g.: unixdt=1490227200.

alerts.description: Disable alerts in forecast API output.

hour.description: Restricting forecast or history output to a specific hour in a given day. Must be in 24 hour. For example 5 pm should be hour=17, 6 am as hour=6.

tools.name: calculator
tools.description: This tool is used for calculating the result of a mathematical expression in the input query.

tools.name: current_weather
tools.description: Current weather or realtime weather API method allows a user to get up to date current weather information in json and xml. The data is returned as a Current Object which contains current or realtime weather information for the given city

q.description:
Query parameter based on which data is sent back. It could be following:1.Latitude and Longitude (Decimal degree) e.g: q=48.8567,2.3508
2.city name e.g.: q=Paris
3.US zip e.g.: q=10001
4.UK postcode e.g: q=SW1
5.Canada postal code e.g: q=G2J
6.metar:<metar code> e.g: q=metar:EGLL
7.iata:<3 digit airport code> e.g: q=iata:DXB
8.auto:ip IP lookup e.g: q=auto:ip
9.IP address (IPv4 and IPv6 supported) e.g: q=100.0.0.1.

lang.description: Returns 'condition:text' field in API in the desired language.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_daily
tools.description: This API returns raw (as-traded) daily time series (date, daily open, daily high, daily low, daily close, daily volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

tools.name: get_stock_time_series_weekly
tools.description: This API returns weekly time series (last trading day of each week, weekly open, weekly high, weekly low, weekly close, weekly volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

tools.name: get_technical_indicator_of_ticker
tools.description: Technical indicator APIs for a given equity or currency exchange pair, derived from the underlying time series based stock API and forex data. All indicators are calculated from adjusted time series data to eliminate artificial price/volume perturbations from historical split and dividend events.

indicator_symbol.description: The symbol of the technical indicator you inquire.

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

symbol.description: The name of the ticker of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

series_type.description: The desired price type in the time series. Four types are supported: close, open, high, low.

tools.name: get_calories_burned
tools.description: Calculate the burned calorie for a specific activity.

activitymin.description: Duration of the activity in minutes.

tools.name: get_acitcity_met_values
tools.description: Get the met values of activities.

tools.name: get_custom_ticker
tools.description: This endpoint can be used to generate a custom index in a certain currency.

if_include.description: The if_include parameter decides whether to generate an index removing specified exchanges, or only including the few that you require. True - if you want the ticker to be calculated using only the exchanges sent as query parameter; False - if you want the price to be calculated using all exchanges, but the ones sent as query parameter.

symbol.description: ETH where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD).

tools.description: Calculate the ideal weight of a person.

tools.description: Get the information of a food.

tools.name: get_ticker_changes
tools.description: Returns ticker values and price changes for specified market and symbol.

if_global.description: True - global; False - local. Default is True

symbol.description: ETH, where is valid ISO currency (ex. ETHUSD, ETHEUR).

date.description: The date you want to check.

SchemeName.description: Scheme name of it. All scheme names can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_names' in the same script.

SchemeType.description: Scheme type of it. All scheme types can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_types' in the same script.

MutualFundFamily.description: Mutual fund family of it. All mutual fund families can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_mutual_fund_families' in the same script.

SchemeCategory.description: Scheme category of it. Scheme categories can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_scheme_categories_by_scheme_type' with param scheme_type in the same script.

SchemeName.description: Scheme name of it. All scheme names can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_names' in the same script.

SchemeType.description: Scheme type of it. All scheme types can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_scheme_types' in the same script.

MutualFundFamily.description: Mutual fund family of it. All mutual fund families can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_all_mutual_fund_families' in the same script.

SchemeCategory.description: Scheme category of it. Scheme categories can be fetched by the function named 'fetch_scheme_categories_by_scheme_type' with param scheme_type in the same script.

query: Fetch me the daily EMA value of the stock 'TSLA' for the last few days
